thread.title: Hero tradies tackle dangerous driver in Brisbane
thread.title_full: Hero tradies tackle dangerous driver in Brisbane | Daily Mail Online

author: Chris Pleasance For Daily Mail Australia
title: Hero tradies tackle dangerous driver in Brisbane
text:
This is the moment a dangerous driver was chased down and tackled by hero tradies after he crashed during a high-speed chase in Brisbane .
A police helicopter pursued the black Volkswagen Golf through the city's south on Wednesday as it was driven at speeds of up to 100km/h often crossing on to the wrong side of the road.
Eventually the driver crashed in the inner-city suburb of Woollongabba, injuring a 52-year-old woman before trying to flee on foot when he was chased by several passers-by.
This is the moment hero tradie Rhys Brown (in white) chased down a dangerous driver after he crashed in Brisbane and tried to flee the scene
Another woman was injured as the driver ran, before he was chased into a building site by several men.
Once inside he ran into the foundations of a building and while trying to climb out was pulled down by two tradesmen and pinned to the floor until officers arrived.
One of those tradies, Rhys Brown, spoke to the Today show about his heroic actions.
'I was just at the set of lights, saw the crash, and then all of a sudden, other mate has taken off. It is just the natural thing to do to chase after someone runs off after a crash,' Mr Brown said.
The driver ran into a building site and tried to climb out of a set of foundations when Mr Brown and another tradie dragged him down and pinned him to the floor
Mr Brown said the man nearly got away from him at first because 'it's been a while since I did a bit of running', but he eventually caught up
'I went to the job site and caught him trying to climb up a wall, I grabbed his leg, pulled him down and then put him in a restraint. So yeah, it was good fun for a day.'
Speaking about the chase, Mr Brown added: 'Mate, I almost fell flat on my face. It's been a while since I've done a bit of running.
'But you know. Once I got my composure, I was straight on him again.'
Police have arrested a 21-year-old man who has been charged with a string of motoring offences and burglary as officers allege the vehicle was stolen
Police have since arrested a 21-year-old man who is now charged with various motoring offences, burglary and fraud.
Officers say the vehicle was one of two stolen from New Farm on Monday.
They were alerted to the dangerous driving after the vehicle's owner used an iPad tracking app to trace the electronic device which had been left inside the vehicle.
